conclusion: Determine the internal resistance of the silicon photocell when connected in a closed circuit with resistor R.
Intersection point of lines a and b gives the operating point of the circuit with coordinates U = 2.5 V and I = 0.2 A.
Line b represents the U-I relationship of resistor R, and its slope gives the value of R.
Calculate the slope of line b using points (0, 0) and (0.4, 4) to find R = 10 Ω.
Voltage across resistor R at intersection point is U_R = IR = 0.2 A × 10 Ω = 2 V.
Using Kirchhoff's voltage law: U_cell - U_R = Ir, where U_cell is terminal voltage at intersection point.
Terminal voltage U_cell at intersection point is 2.5 V.
Substitute known values into equation: 2.5 V - 2 V = 0.2 A × r.
Solve for r: 0.5 V = 0.2 A × r, r = 0.5 V / 0.2 A = 2.5 Ω.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell is 2.5 Ω.
